howToUse.title: How to Use SMPTE Color Bars
steps: Open the page - Navigate to no-signal-smpte-color-bars-screensaver in your browser
Go full screen - Click "Full Screen" or press F11 to display the test pattern across your entire display
Choose your pattern - Switch between SMPTE color bars and no signal test patterns using the controls
Use for calibration - Check color accuracy, brightness, and contrast settings on your monitor or display
Exit anytime - Press Esc or F11 to leave full-screen mode and return to normal viewing

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Common questions about SMPTE color bars and test patterns

whatIsSMPTE.question: What are SMPTE color bars?
whatIsSMPTE.answer: SMPTE color bars are a standardized test pattern used in television and video production to calibrate equipment and ensure accurate color reproduction.

howToUse.question: How do I use this for monitor calibration?
howToUse.answer: Use the color bars to check if your display shows accurate colors. Each bar should display distinct, pure colors without bleeding or distortion.

fullscreen.question: How do I exit fullscreen mode?
fullscreen.answer: Press the Escape key or click the fullscreen button again to exit fullscreen mode. You can also use F11 to toggle fullscreen in most browsers.

download.question: Can I download the color bars pattern?
download.answer: Yes, you can download the color bars pattern in various resolutions. Use the download button in the controls section to save the pattern as a PNG image file.

compatibility.question: What browsers are supported?
compatibility.answer: The color bars screensaver works on all modern browsers including Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge. Fullscreen mode is supported on most devices and browsers.
